timeline.bodyText:
I'm wondering if we should go a under the posted limit, in case the final request size goes over 10 MB with some overhead not accounted for. 🤔
For future reference: https://docs.aws.amazon.com/elasticsearch-service/latest/developerguide/aes-limits.html#network-limits
timeline.author: apeteri

replies.bodyText:
BulkProcessor should handle that well, I think.
Also, the smallest AWS ES instance limit is 10 MiB, which is 10.048576 MB.
If we limit ourselves to 10 MB by default, that should be less than the AWS 10 MiB limit.
replies.author: cmark

replies.bodyText: After a quick discussion, we have decided to set the limit to 9 MB by default to allow a bit of headroom for other parts in the HTTP request.
replies.author: cmark

timeline.message: [index] set default outgoing bulk size to 9 MB
